ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Math 544 is a good introduction to algebraic topology. Sam (topolojesus) is very good lecturer and helpful outside the class. The material can be hard but it is accessible. Th homework is fair and engaging. I would definitely take it again.
It depends on what level he is at. If he is familiar with topology and algebra, then sure take it. Otherwise the workload might be difficult to balance.

544 covers the fundamental group, covering spaces, homology, and some cohomology. No background in algebraic topology is really assumed, but the course doesn't move slowly so it helps to have some familiarity.
The course covered all the basics of fundamental groups, homology, and cohomology from Hatcher. I think the course would be crucial for most pure math graduate students.
Math 544 is a very good second course in algebraic topology. I would highly recommend this course to other students, as it provides solid foundational knowledge for the modern study of topology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I came in knowing knowing about algebraic topology. The course introduced me the subject and many useful techniques while engaging me and sparking new interests. It's all I could have wanted.
It changed how I think about spaces and greatly increased my mathematical maturity
I'm very certain this material will be crucial for my future studies and research.
